thread.title: Kaka takes centre stage as a Power Ranger in seriously cheesy MLS video - social media goes into meltdown
thread.title_full: Kaka takes centre stage as a Power Ranger in seriously cheesy MLS video - social media goes into meltdown

author: Jake Polden
title: Kaka takes centre stage as a Power Ranger in seriously cheesy MLS video - social media goes into meltdown
text:
The MLS has come a long way in a relatively short space of time and as a result is attracting more and more players from Europe. 
But it's new-found sophistication does little to ensure something cringe-worthy is not just around the corner, as the above video proves. 
The clip was posted online by the MLS in a bid to show the world some of their more famous players. 
Of course World Cup winner Kaka takes centre stage in the clip, alongside Bradley Wright-Phillips and former Everton favourite Howard Webb. Go, go Kaka (Photo: Major League Soccer) 
And there's nothing wrong with that, the MLS should be proud to show off the players it is now able to attract to its league. 
It's just the way it went about doing it that seems to have struck a chord with a lot of people on social media, and not one that's in tune. 
Why? Well because instead of having the players roar at the camera or whatever else they get footballers to do these days - embarrassing yes, but not mortifying - they had them pretend to be Power Rangers... Kaka won the World Cup with Brazil once upon a time (Photo: Feng Li) Where did it all go wrong? (Photo: Getty) 
Now there is nothing wrong with the Power Rangers, not if you're five, but it does little to show the league off as 'serious'... at least that's what social media is saying... 
Here are some of the funniest reactions to the EPIC clip: People really aren't happy!
